settings.specialized__what_title: WHAT IS A GASTRIC SLEEVE SURGERY?
settings.specialized__what_content:
Gastric Sleeve Surgery (also known as Vertical Sleeve Gastrectomy) is a medical procedure known as a bariatric surgery that removes 75-80% of the stomach. It is a weight-loss surgery that typically results in an initial weight loss of 50 to 90 lbs.

The primary reason Gastric Sleeve Surgery is for weight loss and to reduce a persons risk of life-threatening conditions causes by weight. These conditions include heart disease, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, type 2 diabetes, stroke, and more.

This is a laparoscopic surgery which means the incisions made in order to preform the surgery are very small. Surgeons use small instruments to make small incisions in the abdomen and to remove part of the stomach. The final result of the Gastric Sleeve Surgery is to have a smaller tube-like shaped stomach.

settings.heading: WHAT IS A BARIATRIC PROCEDURE?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
A bariatric procedure is any operation that makes changes to the digestive system with the goal of weight loss.

A few types of bariatric surgeries include:

  • Gastric Bypass
  • Gastric Band
  • Gastric Sleeve Surgery (this is the most common weight loss surgery in the United States)

settings.heading: WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF BARIATRIC SURGERY?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
Bariatric surgeries like Gastric Bypass, Gastric Band, and Gastric sleeve help with weight loss and can often improve many of the health concerns caused or related to obesity. Here are a few health concerns that could be positively impacted by bariatric surgery:

  • Type 2 Diabetes
  • Heart disease
  • High blood pressure
  • Cholesterol levels
  • Knee, hip, and back pain or soreness
  • Sleep apnea

Following bariatric surgeries and recovery, patients often find they are able to be more physically active and maintain a healthier lifestyle.

settings.heading: ARE THERE RISKS ASSOCIATED TO GASTRIC SLEEVE SURGERY?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
Yes there are some risks associated with the Gastric Sleeve Surgery, they include:

DURING SURGERY:

  • Reactions to anesthesia
  • Blood clots
  • Breathing issues
  • Leaks from exposed sections of the stomach

LONGER TERM ISSUES YOU COULD EXPERIENCE WITH GASTRIC SLEEVE SURGERY INCLUDE:

  • GI Tract Obstructions
  • Malnutrition
  • Vomiting
  • Hernias
  • Hypoglycaemia

AFTER SURGERY YOU MAY EXPERIENCE:

The short term discomforts you may experience following your Gastric Sleeve Surgery include:

  • Body aches and pains
  • Feeling tired and/or lethargic
  • Feeling cold
  • Dry skin
  • Hair thinning and hair loss

settings.heading: HOW LONG DOES HAIR LOSS LAST AFTER GASTRIC SLEEVE SURGERY?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
Hair loss is one of the more common initial symptoms following Gastric Sleeve Surgery. However, it should not be a long-term issue.

Most often, people experience hair loss about 3-6 months following their surgery. After surgery, your body may take time adjusting to changes and hair loss can occur, however hair growth should resume its normal rate as your body begins to regulate.

During this time though, it is important to address any nutritional deficiencies and ensure you're consuming protein regularly. Nutritional deficiencies can cause hair loss and slow hair growth.
